tweets.text: Collection of how people hold their fibers

Clementi2024: Ultrabroadband Resonant Frequency Doubling on a Chip https://arxiv.org/abs/2412.03322 Zhang2024: Broadband and turnkey Pockels micro-comb with Monolithic Microwave Resonator https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/abstract/docum Source of the quote tweet:
“The HYLAB's chip with integrated photonic circuit made of lithium niobate. (Alain Herzog)” https://seas.harvard.edu/news/2023/01/integrated-photonic-circuits-could-help-close-terahertz-gap
Sarabalis2021: Acousto-optics in thin-film lithium niobate, p. 239 https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/13974185
McKenna2019: Cryogenic packaging of an optomechanical crystal https://opg.optica.org/oe/fulltext.cf
Witmer2020: Electro-optic devices for quantum transduction, p. 113 https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/13676750
Laboratory of Photonic integrated circuits and Quantum Measurements, EPFL https://epfl.ch/labs/k-lab/abo Pic gallery: https://www.flickr.com/photos/128145967@N04/page2
Collection of how people hold their fibers

Clementi2024: Ultrabroadband Resonant Frequency Doubling on a Chip https://arxiv.org/abs/2412.03322 Zhang2024: Broadband and turnkey Pockels micro-comb with Monolithic Microwave Resonator https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/abstract/docum Source of the quote tweet:
This one is fiber + lens tube, since I already have it open, might as well include here Rochman2022: Microwave-to-Optical Transduction Using Rare-Earth Ions https://thesis.library.caltech.edu/14579/
Look at those cute thermal straps Craiciu2020: Quantum Storage of Light Using Nanophotonic Resonators Coupled to Erbium Ion Ensembles https://thesis.library.caltech.edu/13759/
Another viewing angle of likely the same setup Kindem2019: Quantum Nanophotonics with Ytterbium in Yttrium Orthovanadate https://thesis.library.caltech.edu/11421/

How could I not include some from the SNSPD folks. Heck they could scan the fiber as a reflective single pixel microscope to get an image lol (I've done this in the near field) Kirkwood2017: Superconducting single photon detectors for quantum information processing https://theses.gla.ac.uk/8136/1/2017kir

Moving on to WGM resonators. These chad built their own stick-slip cryogenic nanopositioners. "The optical fiber tip must be put within 50 nm of the resonator surface and its position must be controllable to about 10 nm." Grudinin2008: Crystalline Whispering Gallery Mode Resonators for Quantum and Nonlinear Optics https://thesis.library.caltech.edu/5186/

What a big TEC for the little chip lol. There is also a nice section on how to make the tapered fiber. The piezo nanopositioner is no longer home make. Looks like from attocube. Suh2017: Nonlinear Optics in Chip-based Microresonators and their Applications https://thesis.library.caltech.edu/10247/

This is brilliant, using the fiber ferrule itself for alignment, and stick a detector (SNSPD) chip in there. Miller2011: Compact cryogenic self-aligning fiber-to-detector coupling with losses below one percent https://doi.org/10.1364/OE.19.009102 Graziosi: Superconducting Nanowire Single Photon Detector (SNSPD) integrated with optical circuits https://phys.uniroma1.it/fisica/sites/default/files/allegati/Graziosi_0.pdf
80 channel fiber arrays Nice aluminum holder + teflon screws Seok2019: Wafer-scale silicon photonic switches beyond die size limit https://doi.org/10.1364/OPTICA.6.000490

Looks like two 3d printed holder. Good to know UHNA fiber array exists. Yao2023: Integrated reconstructive spectrometer with programmable photonic circuits https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-023-42197-3

When you know they are rich. Parihar2025: On-chip power efficient MHz to GHz tunable Brillouin microwave photonic filters https://doi.org/10.1063/5.0236905 Luminos - Fiber Holder Mirrored Left 125/250µm https://www.luminos.com/product-page/fh003-m-1

Looks like there is a 3rd chip below the usual v-groove chip or glass waveguide interposer for extra structural support and strain relief Heim2025: Hybrid integrated ultra-low linewidth coil stabilized isolator-free widely tunable external cavity laser https://arxiv.org/abs/2501.15010

Fiber coming in at an angle likely because they have a facet angle for reducing RL but did not rotate the waveguide Schaijk2018: Model and experimental validation of a unidirectional phase modulator https://doi.org/10.1364/OE.26.
holy smokes four full stacks of attocubes (~>$100k right there) Brainport Eindhoven - Integrated Photonics https://brainporteindhoven.com/int/work/work-on/integrated-photonics

that is a big TEC lol (slowly converting this thread to all fun & informative irl fiber optics setup pictures) Franken2025: High-power and narrow-linewidth laser on thin-film lithium niobate enabled by photonic wire bonding https://doi.org/10.1063/5.0231

Physik Instrumente USA - Cost-Optimized Fast Photonics Alignment System (unlisted) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n6hH14iDGW0 Found in High-Throughput PIC Production Needs Precision Alignment Equipment for Photonics Arrays, Fibers, Lenses https://www.roboticstomorrow.com/article/2025/01/high-throughput-pic-production-needs-precision-alignment-equipment-for-photonics-arrays-fibers-lenses/23880

Another example of using ceramic ferrule and sleeve "Finally, the fiber-containing ceramic ferrule is *meticulously* inserted into the ceramic sleeve previously bonded to the gold mirror" Ran2025: Fiber-tip photothermal transducer with gold-coated multi-beam interferometric cavity for high sensitivity gas detection https://doi.org/10.1063/5.0240821
Bruteforce gluing Ji2025: Full C- and L-band tunable erbium-doped integrated lasers via scalable manufacturing https://arxiv.org/abs/2501.06936
What the hell is that thing that looks like a little hammer Bao2023: Very-large-scale integrated quantum graph photonics https://www.nature.com/articles/s41566-023-01187-z

"300 mm photonics wafer was used, and the array fibers are in contact." In contact?? Kim2025: Insertion loss and polarization-dependent loss measurement improvement to enable parallel silicon photonics wafer-level testing https://doi.org/10.1016/j.optlaseng.2024.108742

"This aluminum box is placed inside an additional aluminum box and then a styrofoam box for further isolation." (they are stabilizing this resonator to within 1 mK) Chauhan2024: Trapped ion qubit and clock operations with a visible wavelength photonic coil resonator stabilized integrated Brillouin laser https://arxiv.org/pdf/2402.16742
This fiber polarization controller looks so small it gives me anxiety. Pathak2014: Silicon Nano-Photonics Based Arrayed Waveguide Gratings https://photonics.intec.ugent.be/download/phd_200.pdf
Prism coupling to a bulk WGM cavity inside a microwave cavity. Sahu2023: Cavity quantum electrooptics https://doi.org/10.15479/at:ista:13175

Fabry-Perot fiber cavity with atoms inside. "The fiber cavities are mounted on a monolithic glass V-groove structure glued onto two shear piezo (CSAP02), which are glued on top of a glass slide. The fiber cavities are mounted into the V-grooves, then low expansion glue (Optocast 3410 Gen2-40K) is applied to the fibers. This is then mounted into an aluminum structure that secures the glass slide." - Grinkemeyer2025: [Error-detected quantum operations with neutral atoms mediated by an optical cavity]( https://doi.org/10.1126/science.adr7075)
rare shear bond strength data - [Scalable low loss cryogenic packaging of quantum memories in CMOS-foundry processed photonic chips]( https://arxiv.org/pdf/2503.14704)

another example of using ferrules for mounting the fibers. I never put in all the screws between the mounting plate and the attocubes the chip is silver pasted (we and many folks usually just clamp it down with e.g. an SEM sample clip) Ulrich2025: [Engineering high Pockels coefficients in thin-film strontium titanate for cryogenic quantum electro-optic applications]( https://arxiv.org/abs/2502.14349)

fiber-attach? flip-chip? gluing? none of these words are in the bible. We are directly aligning DFB lasers and detectors to our PIC (which is a ring with a heater) Sun2025: [A chip-integrated comb-based microwave oscillator]( https://doi.org/10.1038/s41377-025-01795-0)
it hurts or they better have little rubber feet at then end of the screws

fiber attachment with optical epoxy + structural epoxy Klawson2025: [Integrated Optical MEMS for Scalable Trapped Ion Quantum Computing]( https://www2.eecs.berkeley.edu/Pubs/TechRpts/2025/EECS-2025-19.pdf) "The optical epoxy by itself is not sufficient over long-term use. If the SiPh package is moved, there is great risk of the weak, thin optical epoxy breaking. Therefore, a second structural epoxy was used to attach the fiber array more securely. TRA-BOND 2151 was selected, as it is rated for high vacuum space applications by NASA. This epoxy was applied by hand to the fiber array glass v-groove block and cured through exposure to air for 24 hours. Images of the optical epoxy and structural epoxy package can be seen below."
does this fiber holder style trace back to caltech? (left: [Stanford]( https://x.com/heydvdd/status/1917684922095132782), right: [Harvard/EPFL]( https://x.com/jwt0625/status/1871587286909087825))

you were scrolling down the pdf and it got choppy, thats when you know you got a nice high res image coming up. - Qi2025: [Low-loss, fabrication-tolerant, and highly-tunable Sagnac loop reflectors and Fabry-Pérot cavities on thin-film lithium niobate]( https://arxiv.org/abs/2505.23411)
dedicating one "half" of the PCB for the thermistor? Larsen2025: [Integrated photonic source of Gottesman–Kitaev–Preskill qubits]( https://doi.org/10.1038/s41586-025-09044-5)

never seen this kind of holders before Martinez2025: [Scalable erbium-doped waveguide amplifier with external fiber-to-fiber gain using reactively sputtered polycrystalline aluminium oxide]( https://doi.org/10.1364/OE.558707)
long wirebonds for a chip deep inside
those are some really thicc holders Wilson2018: [Integrated gallium phosphide nonlinear photonics]( https://arxiv.org/abs/1808.03554)

this might look confusing, but it's actually a micro-Fabry–Pérot cavity glued to the fiber holder and the chip. The actual fiber is also there and to the side. [Updating an old technology for the quantum age]( https://engineering.yale.edu/news-and-events/news/updating-old-technology-quantum-age) Cheng2025: [Harnessing micro-Fabry–Pérot reference cavities in photonic integrated circuits]( https://doi.org/10.1038/s41566-025-01701-5)
literally holding the fiber with TPP printed "clips"
not really fiber but actually still fiber Briggs2011: [Hybrid Silicon Nanophotonic Devices: Enhancing Light Emission, Modulation, and Confinement]( https://thesis.library.caltech.edu/6483/)

you know it's serious business when the fiber arrays are glued on at an angle (either in-plane or vertically) to reduce backreflection. Grant2022: [Avenues to miniaturize optical gyroscopes]( https://searchworks.stanford.edu/view/14239673)

I like how they made their own fiber holder with adjustible tilt angle, with screws and tension springs. Kramnik2025: [Scalable feedback stabilization of quantum light sources on a CMOS chip]( https://doi.org/10.1038/s41928-025-01410-5) ( [also]( https://arxiv.org/abs/2411.05921) )

that original strain relief mechanism is wild Witt2025: [Packaged cryogenic photon pair source using an effective packaging methodology for cryogenic integrated optics]( https://doi.org/10.1063/5.0283650)

"It is critical that this epoxy is only applied as a small drop on one side, as the difference in thermal contraction between the chip and copper will apply extreme stress to the chip if it is put on multiple sides." (same ref as above)

"We design a custom jig to ensure precise alignment of the bench, spacer, and PIC. Using this jig, along with custom-cut spacers made from plastic shim stock, we are able to maintain a bond line of cryocompatible epoxy (MasterBond EP21TCHT-1) measuring approximately 76 µm for each layer. Pressure is applied with a Teflon-tipped screw from above for approximately 2 h to ensure that the PIC, spacer, and bench are parallel." "Once aligned, the fiber array is raised out of the way and epoxy is applied to two regions: (a) the cryocompatible epoxy is applied to the silicon bench beneath the fiber array; (b) UV epoxy (Norland 63) is applied to the facet of the fiber array. The fiber array is then lowered back into position, forming a bond both below the array and between the array and the PIC. The alignment is optimized and then UV light is applied to the interface for approximately 60 min to ensure a complete cure" Starling2023: [Fully Packaged Multichannel Cryogenic Quantum Memory Module]( https://doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevApplied.19.064028)

interesting fiber array holder, does not feel ideal since it's slim and split Liu2025: [Monolithically Integrated Optical Convolutional Processors on Thin Film Lithium Niobate]( https://arxiv.org/abs/2507.20552)
why are there fiber / wirebond like stuff on the cured epoxy? Drayss2023: [Non-sliced optical arbitrary waveform measurement (OAWM) using soliton microcombs]( https://doi.org/10.1364/OPTICA.484200)
Psaila2023: [Detachable Optical Chiplet Connector for Co-Packaged Photonics]( https://doi.org/10.1109/JLT.2023.3285149)
silicon nitride PIC with PZT from pulsed laser deposition (PLD) for optical control of atoms
first time seeing a laser+TEC mounted vertically.

first time seeing two separately controlled fibers on the same side of the chip. also I see 12 dies, why only measure 8 of them lol. Liu2025: [Wafer-Scale Squeezed-Light Chips]( https://arxiv.org/abs/2509.10445)
big goofy fiber holders from Aluvia Photonics [original post]( https://www.linkedin.com/posts/meetoptics_quantum-computing-is-changing-quickly-and-activity-7374741161791553537-o1vB)

scotch tape ftw (and magnets) Sirbu2025: [AstroPIC II: overview of technology development for a near-infrared photonic integrated coronagraph for the Habitable Worlds Observatory]( https://doi.org/10.1117/12.3065301)
nice teflon holder for the fiber array. Zheng2025: [Microwave Photonics for Space-Ground Connectivity]( https://arxiv.org/abs/2509.18018)

not really how people hold their fibers but how they hold their QD with a fiber. Amazing 50%+ efficiency. Jeon2022: [Plug-and-Play Single-Photon Devices with Efficient Fiber-Quantum Dot Interface]( https://doi.org/10.1002/qute.202200022)

nice angle. a bit surprised they are not worried about the fiber vibrating too much. Pang2025: [Versatile Chip-Scale Platform for High-Rate Entanglement Generation Using an AlGaAs Microresonator Array]( https://doi.org/10.1103/PRXQuantum.6.010338)
Luminos Photonics Integrated Circuit (PIC) Alignment System luminos.com/pic-alignment- …

when your new chip is 2.5x bigger but you forgot to redesign the PCB in time. they also have an interesting definition of integration density. Li2025: [Heterogeneous integration of silicon nitride and amorphous silicon carbide photonics]( https://doi.org/10.1063/5.0285619)

at some point i'll be able to tell which group different kinds of mounting plates and holders are from. This one is imec. Ulrich2025: [Engineering high Pockels coefficients in thin-film strontium titanate for cryogenic quantum electro-optic applications]( https://doi.org/10.1126/science.adx3741) ( [also]( https://arxiv.org/abs/2502.14349) )

coupling of the far-UVC micro-LEDs emitting at 234 nm into multimode fibers of 400–910 μm diameter. Rass2025: [Far-UVC micro-LED arrays for efficient light extraction and fiber coupling]( https://doi.org/10.1063/5.0285251)

hmm interesting fiber holder, never seen plastic tubes used like this. [Nu Quantum Raises $60M Series A in Largest Financing Round for Quantum Computer Networking]( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hQ79NqkDI74)

this is from microwave folks so they are using stycast for the strain relief gluing spot Pan2025: [All-optical control and multiplexed readout of multiple superconducting qubits]( https://arxiv.org/abs/2512.21199)
